name: Michelin-Starred Aburi Hana and Park Hyatt Toronto Celebrate Sakura Season

location.name: Park Hyatt Toronto - 17th Floor Terrace Room

description: Chef Ryusuke Nakagawa of Aburi Hana and Jonathan Williams of Park Hyatt Toronto will collaborate on an exclusive one-night-only dinner. The evening includes a welcome cocktail, canapés, curated wine pairings, and live music. Guests will enjoy an 8-course tasting menu featuring alternating dishes from both chefs. The event marks the finale of Sakura Season and celebrates the meeting of refined Japanese kaiseki and contemporary Canadian cuisine.

name: Toronto Sunday Market
description: Your weekly destination for local shopping and community vibes inside the historic Parkdale Hall. The market features a curated mix of fresh produce, artisan goods, handmade crafts, and vintage finds from Toronto's most creative small businesses. With new vendors each week and seasonal surprises throughout the year, there's always something fresh to discover. Pet-friendly, and open year-round!

name: Textured Art Workshop
description: Learn our texture paste recipe and play with patterns and tools to create art you can hang on your walls. Come with a friend, or on your own. No experience needed!

name: Bayê Bakûr (Northern Breeze)
description:
The renowned Kurdish-Canadian Kamānche player, composer and singer Shahriyar Jamshidi returns with new music and a special project featuring one of the talented Kurdish female voices "Hezil".

A colourful collection of the vocal sounds of Nomad Kurdish Music is chosen from the Zagros Mountains (a mountain range located in Iran, northern Iraq, and southeastern Turkey) foothills through the Çiyayê Agirî (Ararat) mountain (a snow-capped and dormant compound volcano in Eastern Turkey) area which includes diverse musical themes shaped by the diversification of the cultures in the region - will be presented in solo kamānche pieces, the Dengbêjî (Storytelling) vocals and Strāns (songs).

name: World Partnership Walk
description:
Canada's largest public movement dedicated to increasing awareness and raising funds to fight global poverty, is back this spring, and you're invited to be part of it!

Join us in person and take a meaningful step toward building a brighter future. Walk alongside passionate Canadians as we unite to show our support for communities around the globe.

Take your first step today and register for the campaign at the website below.

name: Play Day
description: The annual celebration of student achievement. At this family-friendly event you can enjoy live music, activities and crafts, instrument petting zoos, and student showcase concerts.

organizer.name: The Oscar Peterson School of Music

name: Saturday Night Cumbia Funk & Salsa Party with Sonic Sancocho
description: (Sonic) Sancocho is still warmer than the weather - that's why you should party with us as we kick off a new season! Join us at our HQ for a springtime session of classic cumbia, funky rhythms and spicy salsa flavour. Montreal's Less Toches returns for their second Sonic Sancocho! We welcome our special guest DJ for the night, 936 Traveler - weaving threads of cumbia, Afro-Latin echoes, and tropical cadences, all wrapped in an alternative, underground atmosphere. As always, Founders, Juana Go-gó and olasconola will share a bold blend of music to welcome you to the party. Complimentary cup of Sancocho at midnight for ticket holders - please note: first come, first served.

name: Wild West End Drag Brunch
description:
Kick off Pride month with us!

Starring Anoush Ellah and Renona, as seen on Crave TV's Drag Brunch Saved My Life, come enjoy a show unlike any other, filled with performances, prizes, pizzazz and delicious food, obviously.

name: Rana Farhan and Barzin
description: Legendary New York-based Iranian blues singer Rana Farhan returns to Toronto, pushing boundaries with her new album, Persian Soul. Weaving the timeless poetry of Rumi into original compositions, Farhan seamlessly blends blues, soul and Persian influences in her signature style, which has won audiences worldwide. To set the tone, Iranian-Canadian singer-songwriter Barzin and his band open with eclectic melancholy songs that range from indie to American neo-folk.

name: Lulaworld 2025 - Bruno Capinan Concert and Drag Cabaret - Pride Month Party
description:
Brazilian-born, Toronto based Bruno Capinan previews two new songs and celebrates the re-release of his discography on vinyl. 

As part of this special night to launch Pride month, Bruno will be joined by three leading figures on Toronto's vibrant drag scene including Devine Darlin and Georgina Hudson.

name: Community Environment Day at The Village at Black Creek
description:
Join Councillor Perruzza (Ward 7) and the City of Toronto to help reduce the amount of waste going to landfill. Drop off household items for donation, electronics for reuse or recycling and household hazardous waste for proper disposal. 

Pick up free bagged compost while supplies last and kitchen catchers for organics ($7 each – cash, debit and credit accepted).

name: Resin Art Workshop
description: Create your own stunning Epoxy resin art in this hands-on workshop where you'll design a tray, canvas, coaster set and a UV resin pop socket or pen to take home the same day! With glitter, gold leaf, vibrant pigments, and full creative freedom, this is your time to shine, pour, and create.

name: Saturday Night Rockers - Live Reggae featuring Kirk Diamond and The Movement of Ahryel
description:
Kirk has proven himself to be at the forefront of Toronto's reggae renaissance, with one foot firmly planted in the orthodox, roots-rock-reggae tradition, and the other stepping into more modern influences. He effortlessly spits rapid-fire verses like a seasoned hip-hop MC, while just as easily crooning smooth melodies befitting an RnB superstar. After the performance, there will be some of the city's best DJs playing classic reggae and dancehall 45s.

Don't miss this opportunity to catch a budding star in an intimate setting before it's too late.

name: Highest Drag Show in Toronto
description:
Toronto's highest drag show is back! The CN Tower is thrilled to kick off Toronto's Pride season for a second year with Drag & Haute Cuisine at the 360 Restaurant, hosted by the fabulous Erin Brockobić. 

Join us for lunch where you can sip on mimosas and savour an exclusive menu while enjoying a sickening drag show with performances by Canada's Drag Race and The Traitors Canada's Miss Fiercalicious, Dahlia Doll, Star Doll and Paris Matik, all while the restaurant twirls, overlooking the city below.

name: The World Partnership Walk 2025
description:
Canada's largest public movement dedicated to increasing awareness and raising funds to fight global poverty, is back this spring—and you're invited to be part of it!

Join us for our Walk Day event and take a meaningful step toward building a brighter future. Walk alongside passionate Canadians as we unite to show our support for communities around the globe.

Take your first step today and register for the campaign:
